intro: Fulcaldea, commonly known as the sticky nightshade, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like tomatoes and peppers. The plant is characterized by its small, bell-shaped flowers and hairy, glandular leaves that produce a sticky substance. Its fruits are typically red or yellow berries that contain toxic alkaloids. Fulcaldea is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
